TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OleDbTransaction extends System.Data.Common.DbTransaction

Docs.summary: Represents an SQL transaction to be made at a data source. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The application creates an OleDbTransaction object by calling <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction%2A> on the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection> object. All subsequent operations associated with the transaction (for example, committing or aborting the transaction), are performed on the OleDbTransaction object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction Begin() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new transaction is nested within the current transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction Begin(valuetype System.Data.IsolationLevel isolevel) cil managed

Docs.param: The isolation level to use for the transaction.
Docs.summary: Initiates a nested database transaction and specifies the isolation level to use for the new transaction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The new transaction is nested within the current transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Commit() cil managed

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection> and an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction>. It also demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction%2A>, a Commit, and <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction.Rollback%2A> methods.
[!code-cs[Classic WebData OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.data.oledb.oled_13_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.data.oledb.oled_13_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: An error occurred while trying to commit the transaction.

The transaction has already been committed or rolled back.
-or-
The connection is broken.

Docs.summary: Gets the object associated with the transaction, or if the transaction is no longer valid.
Docs.value: The object associated with the transaction.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A single application may have multiple database connections, each with zero or more transactions. This property lets you determine the connection object associated with a particular transaction created by <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.value: The for this transaction. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Parallel transactions are not supported. Therefore, the <xref:System.Data.IsolationLevel> applies to the whole transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Rollback() cil managed

Docs.summary: Rolls back a transaction from a pending state.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The transaction can only be rolled back from a pending state (after <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction%2A> has been called, but before <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction.Commit%2A> is called). The transaction will be rolled back in the event it is disposed before `Commit` or `Rollback` is called.
## Examples The following example creates an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection> and an <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction>. It also demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction%2A>, a <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbTransaction.Commit%2A>, and Rollback methods.
[!code-cs[Classic WebData OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.data.oledb.oled_10_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData OleDbConnection.BeginTransaction1 Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.data.oledb.oled_10_1.vb)]

Docs.exception: An error occurred while trying to commit the transaction.

The transaction has already been committed or rolled back.
-or-
The connection is broken.
